ticket.title: {:subclasses=>:descendants} is not a symbol

I am getting this error, looks like it is a Rails bug.

version.title: {:subclasses=>:descendants} is not a symbol

version.body:
You appear to be using the [deprecated](http://github.com/erikh/deprecated) gem. However rails uses it's own deprecate internal methods. It's including this gem which breaks everything.
You can find [the deprecation folder](http://gist.github.com/rails/rails/tree/master/activesupport/lib/active_support/deprecation) and [the tests](http://gist.github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activesupport/test/deprecation_test.rb)
version.body-html:
You appear to be using the deprecated gem.
However rails uses it's own deprecate internal methods. It's including this gem which breaks everything.

You can find the deprecation folder and the tests
version.title: {:subclasses=>:descendants} is not a symbol

version.body: That is true! But deprecated gem is required by 'dbi' gem. Who need to fix that?DBI or Rails?
version.body-html:
That is true!
But deprecated gem is required by 'dbi' gem. Who need to fix that?DBI or Rails?
version.title: {:subclasses=>:descendants} is not a symbol

version.body: If this is a Deprecated gem problem, i cant understand why in Rails Beta4 works and in Rails3 RC dont work =/

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.title: {:subclasses=>:descendants} is not a symbol

version.body:
Hi Santiago,
The only gem that uses this deprecated gem as a dependency is dbi, i created a new version of dbi gem called dbi-rails, compatible with Rails 3 because dont need these deprecated classes.
version.body-html:
Hi Santiago,

The only gem that uses this deprecated gem as a dependency is dbi, i created a new version of dbi gem called dbi-rails, compatible with Rails 3 because dont need these deprecated classes.
